title: Securing Tethered Photography Workflow with Tether Tools
summary: Photographer Peter Hurley addresses the common issue of tether cables disconnecting during shoots. He unboxes and demonstrates a suite of Tether Tools products designed to secure the connection and improve the on-set workflow.

steps.action: Demonstrate the problem: FireWire cable easily falls out of the Hasselblad camera port during movement or vertical shooting.
Unbox the Tether Tools kit containing cables, clamps, and mounting hardware.
Identify the JerkStopper, a device specifically designed to prevent cable disconnects.
Unbox the Tether Table Aero, a platform for holding the laptop on a stand.
Show the assembled setup: Laptop secured on the Tether Table Aero mounted on a tripod.
Demonstrate the JerkStopper installed on the camera, relieving strain on the port and preventing disconnection.

key_takeaways: Loose tether cables can disrupt workflow and potentially damage camera ports.
The JerkStopper is a critical tool for relieving cable strain and ensuring a secure connection.
A dedicated tether table (like the Tether Table Aero) provides a secure and professional station for the laptop on location.
Avoid using FireWire cables longer than 15 feet to prevent connection instability.
